sections.title: A functional language with familiar syntax
sections.content: Madlib tries to be the pragmatic functional programming language. It embraces function composition and mutation is only possible as an affordance in safe places. It is powered by a Hindley-Milner type system which means, great guarantees without requirements. In fact most if not all type annotations are optional and the compiler can infer them.

sections.title: Tooling
sections.content: Thanks to a powerful type system, we're able to propose interesting tooling such as auto generating documentation with types without having to annotate any type. There's an existing language server that is already available via the vscode plugin, which helps you get in-ide feedback of what types you manipulate but also give you real time errors for a more integrated experience and a faster feedback loop.
